title: Gasing Guardian
description: Built a physics-based grappling hook, player combat system, and enemy AI for a 2D platformer.

detailedInfo.overview: Gasing Guardian is a 2D physics-based platformer created in Unity. The game blends traditional Malaysian culture with fast-paced, modern gameplay. Players control a hero armed with a 'gasing' (a traditional top) which functions as a versatile grappling hook, combat weapon, and puzzle-solving tool.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Project Manager, I led a team of 5, organizing sprints, managing tasks via Trello, and ensuring we met all our milestones.

As the lead Gameplay Programmer, my primary responsibilities included:

  • Physics-Based Grappling Hook: Engineered the core gasing mechanic from scratch.
  • Player Combat System: Developed the state machine for player combat.
  • Enemy AI: Programmed the basic AI for ground-based enemies.

title: Super Nasi Odyssey
description: Developed an 8-way character movement and a timeline-based cutscene system in Unreal Engine for a 2.5D adventure platformer.

detailedInfo.overview:
Aish learns a hard lesson about wasting food when she's cursed by a mysterious wizard! Now trapped in a 2D pixel-art form, she must leap across strange and dangerous multiverses to collect enough food to break the curse.

Super Nasi Odyssey is a fast-paced 2.5D precision platformer where every second counts. Test your reflexes, solve environmental puzzles, and master Aish's abilities to navigate two challenging levels.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Project Manager and Gameplay Programmer, I led a team of 4 to deliver this technical showcase.

  • Advanced Movement: Developed a responsive 8-way character movement system.
  • Cutscene System: Implemented a timeline-based cutscene system for narrative delivery.
  • Visual Effects: Created particle systems including running VFX to enhance game feel.
  • Technical Implementation: Utilized the PaperZD plugin to integrate 2D sprite-based animation systems within a 3D Unreal Engine world.

title: Seru Hooty
description: Programmed all core physics and timing-based puzzle mechanics for a 3D puzzle game using Unity.

detailedInfo.overview: Seru Hooty is a 3D puzzle game that challenges player precision and patience. The core gameplay loop revolves around movement timing; players must navigate the environment wisely and smoothly to avoid obstacles in a rhythm-like fashion.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I was responsible for the entire codebase for this project and also designed the 2nd level.

  • Core Logic: Programmed every aspect of the game from scratch in C#.
  • Physics & Timing: Implemented the core movement timing mechanics and collision detection.
  • UI Implementation: Integrated Aseprite assets into Unity for the user interface.

title: Elian's Bloom
description: Coded all game logic and implemented visual special effects for a 2D game in Pygame.

detailedInfo.overview:
Elian's Bloom is a 2D narrative platformer developed in Python. The story follows Elian, a young boy on an urgent quest to find the 'Golden Bloom' to cure his mother's mysterious 'Wither' sickness.

The journey takes Elian from the corrupted 'Green Tangle' to the magical 'Golden Grove'. Gameplay relies on core platforming mechanics like running, jumping, dashing, and wall-jumping to overcome environmental obstacles and enemies.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Lead Programmer and Level Designer, my focus was on building a robust engine using Pygame.

  • Core Engine: Coded the majority of the game logic, including physics and collision, using Python 3.11 and Pygame CE.
  • Visual Effects: Implemented dynamic special effects to visualize the 'Wither' sickness and magical elements.
  • Level Editor: Built and utilized a custom level editor to design the game's two distinct environments.

title: Dungeon Escape (Board Game)
description: Designed and balanced a 3-4 player survival horror board game with PvE/PvP mechanics.

detailedInfo.overview:
Dungeon Escape is a competitive, turn-based survival horror board game for 3-4 players. Players must navigate a dangerous 25x25 grid maze, roll dice to move, and race to find one of two hidden keys to escape.

The twist? A minotaur hunts the players down, advancing after every turn. Players must balance speed and risk, deciding whether to sabotage their friends or focus on their own survival while avoiding traps and the ever-encroaching beast.
detailedInfo.contributions:
My primary contributions were in game design and quality assurance.

  • Game Design & Balancing: Designed the card content and wrote the comprehensive rulesheet to ensure clarity and fairness.
  • QA Testing: Conducted playtests to balance the PvE and PvP mechanics, ensuring the 'Minotaur' threat felt fair but formidable.
  • Visuals: Assisted with asset creation using Photoshop and Canva.

title: Midnight Arcade Mayhem (VR)
description: Programmed the core enemy AI (sleepwalking mum) and designed the house level layout for a comedic VR horror-arcade game.

detailedInfo.overview:
Midnight Arcade Mayhem plunges you into the shoes of a young boy on a mission to play all four hidden arcade minigames before 6 AM—without waking up your sleepwalking mother.

Built for the Meta Quest 2, this VR experience blends stealth, arcade, and horror genres. You must use environmental awareness to tip-toe through hallways, duck behind furniture, and evade the terrifying gaze of Mom.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I focused on the level design and enemy AI implementation for VR.

  • Level Design: Designed the house layout using low-poly models optimized for VR performance on the Quest 2.
  • AI Programming: Implemented the 'Sleepwalking Mum' AI using Unity's NavMesh system with random patrol paths.
  • VR Integration: Ensured smooth locomotion and interaction mechanics within the VR environment.

title: Page of Peril
description: Managed a team of 5, designed all puzzles, and wrote the game narrative based on a 2D-to-3D world-switching mechanic.

detailedInfo.overview:
Page of Peril is a narrative-driven puzzle-platformer set within a child’s notebook. You play as 'Sketch', a stickman entity who gains sentience and tries to escape the drawing world.

The core mechanic involves a dimension-shifting ability. Players can toggle between a 2D Orthographic view and a 3D Perspective view to reveal hidden paths, bypass 'impassable' 2D obstacles, and manage their 'Ink' stamina.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the Project Manager and Lead Designer.

  • Project Management: Managed a team of 5 over 12 weeks to deliver the project using Unity 6.
  • Puzzle Design: Designed the environmental puzzles that require switching between 2D and 3D perspectives.
  • Narrative Writing: Wrote the game narrative centered around Sketch's fight for freedom.

title: Sugar Slasher
description: Managed the team and programmed core gameplay, including the enemy wave spawner, for a 2-week game jam.

detailedInfo.overview:
The last magical girl has returned — rebuilt as a cybernetic warrior. 100 years after the magical war, her mission is to hunt down the cyborg general who destroyed her world.

Sugar Slasher is a fast-paced arcade shoot ’em up that mixes bright magical girl visuals with cyberpunk vibes. Blast through waves of enemies and master the parry mechanic to survive the final boss battle in the heart of Tokyo.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the Project Manager and Lead Game Designer for this 6-person team.

  • Management: Organized the team workflow for the Magical Girl Game Jam #12.
  • Gameplay Programming: Coded the core gameplay loop and the enemy wave spawner system.
  • Game Design: Designed the player mechanics, including the unique bullet parry system.

title: Luggage Buds
description: Created UI and background assets in Aseprite for a 5-person team during a 48-hour game jam.

detailedInfo.overview:
Tappy, Bam, Ogu, and Biggie woke up realizing they haven't packed! Help them sort their luggage so they can catch their flight.

Luggage Buds is a cute pixel-art organization game created for the Red Games Jam 2025 (Sponsored by AirAsia). It tests your speed and sorting skills under a tight time limit.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I focused on the artistic direction, specifically UI and Environment.

  • UI Design: Created all user interface elements including menus and buttons using Aseprite.
  • Background Art: Designed the background environments to fit the cute, vibrant pixel art style.
  • Rapid Prototyping: Delivered all assets within the strict 48-hour deadline.

title: Seven Days to Feed
description: Designed all environmental tilemaps and UI icons for a 4-person team.

detailedInfo.overview:
A mysterious wizard has cursed your village for wasting food. You play as a farmer with limited resources who must grow enough food to feed the village or face seventy years of starvation.

Inspired by the theme 'Outplay Hunger', you must plant seeds, water crops, and use fertilizer to fend off pests in this farming management game.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I was the primary Environment Artist for Team Sleepy Devs.

  • Environment Design: Designed the complete farmland environment tilemaps using Aseprite.
  • Icon Design: Created the UI icons for the farming tools (scythe, water, fertilizer).
  • Collaboration: Worked closely with the programmer to ensure assets fit the grid-based gameplay.

title: No Signal
description: Designed the level and game logic for a top-down atmospheric puzzle game where light is your lifeline.

detailedInfo.overview:
No Signal is a top-down atmospheric puzzle game built around the theme of 'Signal/Light Loss'. The goal is simple but stressful: reach the Signal Booster exit before the screen goes completely black.

The game features a shrinking 'vision circle' mechanic—players have exactly 60 seconds to navigate a static maze before their field of view reaches zero and they are lost in the darkness.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I was responsible for the Level Design and core Game Logic.

  • Level Design: Built the maze layout using Unity Tilemap and ProBuilder, placing start/end points and defining collision boundaries.
  • Scope Management: Focused on a 'No-Crunch' scope by utilizing geometric shapes instead of complex assets to finish within 48 hours.

title: Quizzard (Web App)
description: Built a gamified e-learning RPG site using PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript, including a points/badges/leveling system.

detailedInfo.overview:
Quizzard is a gamified e-learning web application designed to make studying engaging. It treats education like an RPG: students earn XP for answering quizzes correctly, climb the competitive leaderboard, and unlock special badges at certain levels.

The platform supports user accounts, progress tracking, and dynamic quiz generation, bridging the gap between study and play.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the Backend Developer and assisted with frontend flow.

  • Backend Development: Designed the MySQL database schema and wrote the PHP scripts to handle user authentication, quiz logic, and XP calculations.
  • Frontend Flow: Created the website wireframes and helped implement the user journey using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • System Integration: Connected the frontend UI with the backend database to ensure real-time leaderboard updates.

title: HR Management System
description: Built a Java SWING desktop app for managing employee records with Google GSON for database operations.

detailedInfo.overview:
The HR Management System is a desktop application built with Java SWING. It is designed to help administrators efficiently manage workforce data.

Key features include adding new employee records, calculating payroll based on salary bands, and maintaining a persistent database using local JSON files via the Google GSON library. It simplifies the CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations required for basic HR tasks.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I co-developed the core logic and user interface.

  • Logic Implementation: Implemented the CRUD logic for employee management and the math logic for payroll calculations.
  • Data Persistence: Integrated Google GSON to save and load employee data from local .json files, ensuring data isn't lost between sessions.
  • UI/UX Flow: Designed the login screen and the navigation flow between the dashboard and management panels.

title: Service Management System
description: A modern desktop app built with Python and CustomTkinter to manage a laptop repair shop. Features role-based dashboards and job tracking.

detailedInfo.overview:
Abu Laptop Repair Service Management System is a modern desktop application designed to streamline operations for a repair shop. Built entirely in Python using CustomTkinter, it offers a fresh Dark Mode UI without the complexity of a database server.

The system features distinct workflows for 4 user roles: Admins (financial reports), Technicians (job updates), Receptionists (customer intake), and Customers (status tracking), all powered by local CSV storage.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I revamped this diploma assignment as a solo project, coding the entire application from scratch.

  • Full Stack Development: Coded the GUI, logic, and data handling using Python.
  • Data Management: Implemented a CSV-based storage system to handle user authentication and job tickets without an SQL database.
  • UI/UX Design: Utilized CustomTkinter to create a clean, modern interface with role-specific dashboards.

title: Ajar Akademi
description: Developed a simplified quiz web app with distinct teacher and admin roles using PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS,and JavaScript.

detailedInfo.overview:
Ajar Akademi is a web-based educational platform serving as a simplified version of the 'Quizzard' project. It focuses on the core administrative side of e-learning, separating functions between Teachers and Admins.

Teachers can create and manage assessments, while Administrators oversee user accounts and system integrity. It was built to demonstrate a solid understanding of CRUD operations in a web environment.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I led the backend development and initial design phase.

  • Backend Architecture: Designed and implemented the MySQL database and PHP logic for user roles and quiz data.
  • Wireframing: Created the website wireframes to establish the user flow and interface layout.
  • Project Management: Coordinated the 4-person team to ensure feature delivery over the 6-week timeline.

title: Online Game Tournament
description: Organized an online 'Stumble Guys' tournament for 44 participants; designed all marketing materials and served as the live event emcee.

detailedInfo.overview:
CC1 (Co-curricular Event 1) was a student-led initiative where we organized an online e-sports tournament for 'Stumble Guys'. The event brought together 44 participants for a night of competitive fun.

Hosted entirely on Discord and managed via Google Forms, the event required precise coordination to run a smooth knockout-style tournament live on stream.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I wore multiple hats to ensure the event's success.

  • Event Management: Oversaw the 6-week planning phase and coordinated the 14-person committee during the live event.
  • Marketing Design: Designed the promotional posters and social media assets using Canva.
  • Live Operations: Served as the Emcee, engaging with participants and managing the flow of the tournament via OBS and Discord.

title: University Game Booth
description: Managed a 14-person team to run a physical university game booth, directing all operations and exceeding fundraising goals by 33%.

detailedInfo.overview:
For our Co-Curricular Project, I managed a 14-person team to develop and run a physical game booth on campus. The goal was to engage students and raise funds through interactive gaming experiences.

We featured a mix of digital and traditional games, including 'Taiko no Tatsujin' and 'Batu Seremban'. Through strategic planning and merchandise sales, we successfully raised RM200, exceeding our initial target of RM150 by 33%.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Event Manager, I directed all operational aspects of the booth.

  • Operations Management: Directed the game selection, prize management, and merchandise inventory.
  • Team Leadership: Managed the shift roster and task delegation for 14 committee members over the 5-day event.
  • Financial Success: Oversaw the budget and sales strategy, resulting in a 33% surplus over our fundraising goal.

title: Samsung Internship Talk
description: Led a 14-person team to plan and execute a professional internship talk with Samsung, overseeing marketing, PR, and event-day logistics.

detailedInfo.overview:
As part of the Workplace Professional Skills module, I led a team of 14 to organize a high-profile internship talk featuring guest speakers from Samsung Malaysia's HR and Marketing departments.

The event was designed to prepare students for the corporate world, offering insights into internship applications and industry expectations.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the Event Manager, overseeing the entire project lifecycle.

  • Project Leadership: Oversaw all project streams including Public Relations (speaker invitations), Marketing, and Logistics.
  • Quality Assurance: Ensured all project deliverables met strict module requirements.
  • Content Creation: Utilized Photoshop and DaVinci Resolve to produce professional marketing materials and video montages.

title: Entrepreneurship Booth
description: Assisted as project manager and marketing lead for a 'Spin-the-Wheel' booth, helping the team exceed the fundraising target by 100%.

detailedInfo.overview:
For the Fundamentals of Entrepreneurship module, we launched 'Scoop-n-Go', a pop-up booth featuring a 'Spin-the-Wheel' concept to drive sales.

By leveraging a strategic location and optimizing our prize-to-price ratio, we created a high-traffic stall that smashed our initial fundraising goal of RM150, achieving RM307 in revenue in a single day.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the Assistant Project Manager and Marketing Lead.

  • Business Strategy: Co-developed the business concept, focusing on location analysis and competitive pricing.
  • Marketing Design: Designed eye-catching marketing posters using Canva to attract footfall.
  • Sales Execution: Helped manage the booth operations, ensuring high energy and customer engagement throughout the day.

title: Social Media PSA
description: Served as the primary actor and narrator for a high-production PSA video educating viewers on the dangers of oversharing personal information.

detailedInfo.overview:
This Social Media Oversharing PSA is a narrative-driven video produced to raise awareness about digital safety. The story follows a young man who finds a 'girlfriend' through a dating app, only to discover she is a scammer who blackmails him after he shares private photos.

The video serves as a cautionary tale about the real-world consequences of sharing too much personal information with strangers online.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the primary talent and creative assistant.

  • Acting: Played the lead role, conveying the emotional arc from excitement to dread.
  • Voice-Over: Provided the narration to guide the educational message.
  • Production Support: Assisted with scriptwriting and post-production editing using DaVinci Resolve and Audacity.

title: Movie Brochure Design
description: Designed a professional, print-ready tri-fold brochure for 'Howl's Moving Castle' using Adobe Photoshop.

detailedInfo.overview:
This project involved designing a professional, print-ready tri-fold brochure for the Studio Ghibli classic Howl's Moving Castle. The design aesthetic captures the whimsical and vibrant style of the film using a scrapbook-collage technique.

The layout features a 'Magnum Opus' timeline of Hayao Miyazaki's career on the outer spread, while the inner folds provide deep dives into the characters Howl and Sophie, framed by film strips and torn paper effects.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I was the sole Graphic Designer for this 12-week project.

  • Layout Design: structured the tri-fold layout to balance information flow between the 'Director's Timeline' and 'Character Bios'.
  • Visual Composition: Created a cohesive aesthetic using film reel motifs, cloud textures, and vibrant Ghibli blue tones.
  • Print Readiness: Ensured all assets were high-resolution and correctly formatted for professional printing.

title: Retail Behavior Analysis
description: Analyzed a large retail dataset using R to identify statistically significant correlations between payment methods and customer ratings.

detailedInfo.overview:
This project involved a deep statistical analysis of a large retail dataset to determine factors influencing customer satisfaction. Using RStudio, I built logistic regression models to quantify the relationship between payment methods and customer ratings.

The findings revealed that payment method is a highly statistically significant predictor: Cash users showed a higher propensity for 'High' ratings (p-value 0.0002), while Debit and PayPal users had significantly lower odds of leaving positive reviews.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I performed the end-to-end data analysis pipeline.

  • Statistical Modeling: Calculated log-odds coefficients and p-values to prove the significance of payment methods on ratings.
  • Model Evaluation: Used Null Deviance vs. Residual Deviance and AIC metrics to validate the model's explanatory power.
  • Data Visualization: Created stacked and dodged bar charts using ggplot2 to visualize the rating distribution across different payment types.

title: Event Booking App UI/UX
description: Designed a high-fidelity event booking app prototype in Figma, featuring a comprehensive user journey from event discovery to ticket purchase.

detailedInfo.overview:
This project focused on the UI/UX design of a general event booking mobile application. The goal was to create a seamless user experience that allows users to easily discover local events, view details, and secure tickets.

The high-fidelity prototype covers the complete user journey, starting from the Home Feed and Search, moving through Event Details, and concluding with a streamlined Checkout process.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the UI/UX Designer within a team of 4.

  • Prototyping: Created a clickable high-fidelity prototype in Figma to demonstrate the full application flow.
  • Design System: Established a consistent design language, including a standardized color palette, typography hierarchy, and a library of reusable components (buttons, cards, inputs) to ensure visual coherence.
  • User Flow: Mapped out the user journey from browsing to payment confirmation.

title: 2D Level Design
description: Designed a narrative-driven 2D Unity level focusing on environmental storytelling across three distinct biomes.

detailedInfo.overview:
This project is a dedicated study in 2D Level Design and Environmental Storytelling. It follows the journey of a protagonist travelling across the world to rescue her kidnapped husband.

The level takes the player through a visual progression of three distinct biomes: starting in a calm Beach & Forest, traversing the treacherous Plains & Cliffs (leading to a Castle), and descending into a dangerous Underground Lava zone.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I focused purely on the level architecture and visual composition.

  • Environmental Storytelling: Designed the level layout to visually narrate the journey from safety (beach) to danger (lava) without dialogue.
  • Tilemap Design: Utilized Unity's Tilemap system to paint complex, layered 2D environments.
  • Scene Composition: Managed the placement of assets and background layers to create depth and atmosphere across the three unique zones.
